Intention to continue "restructuring" declared
articles.content:
Intention to continue "restructuring" declared
   Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- The anti-social "government" of South Korea declared to its intention continue the murderous "restructuring" on May 2, according to a Seoul-based radio report.
   The "Ministry of Finance and Economy" betrayed this intention, announcing that the "basic economic policy" would be maintained.
   The continued "restructuring" means an increase of the jobless.
   Such intention to continue "restructuring" under the pressure of the International Monetary Fund, disregarding workers' existence, is a vicious challenge to their demand for vital rights.

articles.title: Press conference at Polish embassy
articles.content:
Press conference at Polish embassy
    Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Mieczyslaw Dedo, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Polish embassy  here, called a press conference at the embassy on Wednesday to mark the National Day of Poland.
   He said the first Polish constitution was adopted on May 3, 1791 and this day has been marked as the National Day in Poland. He referred to the aim and significance of the constitution.
   He also mentioned the situation and foreign policy of Poland and the bilateral relations between Poland and the DPRK.

articles.content:
S. Korean people's struggle supported
    Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- A joint meeting of workers, farmers and students in Hamhung city was held on May 5 in support of the solidarity struggle of their South Korean counterparts.
   At the meeting speakers said that the South Korean authorities, upset by the struggle of people from all walks of life, have called all repressive tools out to merciless suppression of it.
  They said the struggle is sure to win, adding that all the working class, agricultural  workers and students will always stand on the side of the South Korean people in the struggle.

Kim Jung Rin meets Australian party member
articles.content:
Kim Jung Rin meets Australian party member 
   Pyongyang, May 6 (KCNA) -- Secretary Kim Jung Rin of the Central Committee of the Worker's Party of Korea met Michael Perth,  member of the c.c., the Communist Party of Australia, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
   Michael said that during his stay he was deeply moved to see the Korean people registering great successes in socialist construction in face of aggression and suffocation maneuverings of the imperialists.
   He said that his party extended full support and solidarity to the struggle of the Korean people for the country's reunification.
